author: johnydony
content:
Guys. 
I'm wonder that why `beacon API` isn't support per `slot` status API. 
Is there some reason why `beacon API` supports per `epoch` basis?

author: johnydony
content: I know that slot is just time frame in the PoS perspective, I would like to ask why api was missing such like `/v1/beacon/slot/[slotnumber]`.

author: jgm
content: It uses slots where appropriate, for example https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/#/Beacon/getBlockV2

author: sky.cactus
content: It matches the execution layer's JSON-RPC specification, and as mentioned above it simplifies parsing and generation code because you can just always prepend/strip the `0x` regardless of the length of the data (including 0 length).

author: jgm
content: Not sure that following the JSON-RPC specification is any sort of good idea, but as stated we seem to be stuck with it.

author: sky.cactus
content: Not using JSON-RPC would have been a good start.  I do think that if we are going to go with it though there is notable value in following the already established standard in clients so we don't have to rewrite tooling just because of one or two tiny differences here and there.

author: sky.cactus
content: If new tooling is going to be needed, I think we should get a lot of bang for that work, which means total revamp (with lots of wins) rather than subtle differences (with few wins)

author: jgm
content: Well the CL API is REST not JSON-RPC, so it's different enough to begin with that I don't think there would have been any significant value in attempting to combine them.  Plus, at the time the CL API was originally mooted it was still the general idea to have execution shards so the JSON-RPC API would have gone away entirely and as such compatibility wasn't a significant consideration.  All history, now.
